intro: Aconitum balcanicum, commonly known as Balkan aconite, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers in late summer, arranged in racemes at the top of the stem. Its leaves are palmately compound, with deeply lobed divisions, and the plant has a reputation for containing potent alkaloids. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care and avoid ingestion.
